H0.text: Its path widens as a light ray passes from air into water at an angle.

H1.text: Its path bends when a light ray passes from air into water at an angle.

H2.text: Its path becomes shorter as a light ray passes from air into water at an angle.

H3.text: Its path continues in a straight line as a light ray passes from air into water at an angle.

A4.text: When light enters a slower medium at an angle, one side of the wavefront is slowed before the other. This asymmetrical slowing of the light causes it to change the angle of its travel.

A5.text: Refraction occurs when light goes through a water surface since water has a refractive index of 1.33 and air has a refractive index of about 1.
